Description: Steatite scarab: engraved on the base with an elaborate heraldic design. In the centre is the goddess Nekhbet in vulture form, 'en face', with widespread wings holding an ankh sign on one side and a nfr (?) on the other. A winged uraeus is on either side of her head. Below is a beetle flanked either side by a 'mʒʿt' sign and a uraeus. Below all, 'nb' in the exergue.
Curator's comments: Cf. scarab 1884,0714.200 (BM 48214) also from Amrit and the parallel from Kition Clerc, 'Fouilles de Kition' II, p.77; Kit. 820.
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.146, no.28)
